text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen so I 
love mussels I love them can you do them anyway

chances are I'm gonna love it but today's recipe 
is extra-special because these mussels are going

to get smothered in all sorts of tires that are my 
favorite and it's super fast super easy and it's

got a very impressive name so it's called hoi ob malangpu 
samunprai huh super impressive you

can say that to your friends hoi malangpu 
is mussels Ob means sort of to cook something

in an enclosed space and samunprai is herbs 
so so good so let's get started cooking good

mussels come down to this one thing a delicious 
broth you get the broth you dump the mussels

in close the lids 2 minutes and it's done so it 
goes fast you want to make sure that you've got

all the ingredients ready to go and lay it out 
like I've got here and I'll talk about them as

I add them to the pot a little bit of oil just a 
little let's start with sauteing some garlic and

onion I'm using garlic and red onion now you could 
definitely use shallows shallows are very common

and mussels I just happen to have red onions in 
the fridge that I wanted to use up my original

recipe didn't have any garlic and then someone on 
facebook said I love mussels with lots of garlic

and I was like oh how did I not think about that 
so give that a little time to cook and soften and

let the flavors infuse into the oil okay this 
is pork stock but you can just do chicken stock

and now all my someone prior all my herbs some 
lemongrass which I finly sliced now we just need

the lemongrass to infuse I'm not gonna actually 
eat that some galangal slices in there of course

kaffir lime leaves which I've torn into sort of 
chunks I remove the center ribs so that's a lot

that's okay I love it some tide shelley's now 
these are Thai chilies that I've crushed until

they're broken but they're kept whole so that way 
no one is going to accidentally eat the little

piece of chili but it's just going to gently 
infuse the heat into the broth some Tomatoes so

cherry tomatoes you can just use regular Tomatoes 
if you want at the end they'll just sort of break

down into the broth and I find it really adds 
some extra flavor a little extra richness to

this broth as well add some fish sauce to flavor 
it I know some of you are thinking that looks like

boom yum and it does but in the end I'm going to 
add something else that's gonna make it a little

different from Ricky laughs boom yeah bring that 
to a boil so here are my mussels that I bought

this morning now you want to make sure they're 
all alive and well so first of all smell them so

if they smell bad that's not good and if they're 
open give them a little tap and if they close they

won't close right away sometimes it takes them 
a few a few seconds to sort of wake up if they

close and that means they're alive so they're 
good if they're open and they won't close our

dead throw them away so make sure you scrub them 
clean some mussels that you buy some stores will

have them pristinely cleaned for you you don't 
have to worry about that but you know mine came

a little rustic so my broth is now boiling I'm 
going to dump my mussels in close it right away

now this is going to take about two minutes and 
what you're looking for is for the mussels to

open so if you've got a plot with clear lid it 
helps a lot then you don't have to open the lid

to see if they're open so now we just kind of 
hang out and wait and you can if you want open

and you know give it a flip just to check out 
what's going on it's okay nothing bad is going

to happen most of them are open now I've got a 
couple that's still a little bit of a bloomer

so we'll give them a few more seconds almost done 
mussels are done I'm going to turn it off and who

check that out mmm oh so so good I'm going to add 
my finishing herbs now I've got some Thai basil

now this is what's going to make it different from 
the regular Thummim so you just want the heat of

the broth to wilt the Thai basil I'm also going 
to add some cilantro fresh chopped cilantro one

last thing I'm going to add is some more Tomatoes 
just because the other ones have already mushed

by this point so I just want some orange and red 
tomatoes just to give it some extra colour I'm

going to close it just for a few seconds just 
using the residual heat to let the steam sort

of wilt and bring everything together and then 
go get your plates and table setting and we're

almost done so there are two ways you can go about 
finishing this off you can serve it as is look at

that oh that's a big muscle you can leave it 
as is and what you're gonna get is sort of a

savory broth but I can also add some lime juice 
and turn it into something that's a little more

tart and refreshing either way is really go so you 
really can't go wrong so give it a taste first at

this point and then if you decide you know what I 
want some tartness you can go in with a little bit

of lime juice and then give the broth a taste ooh 
the smell that Thai basil is permeating this room

mmm that garlic was such a good idea all right 
let's plate this up this is not traditionally

Thai but this dish is great served with some 
toasted bread so I've got here some toasted

sourdough so you can have something to dip in that 
broth oh I almost forgot if there are muscles that

didn't open you could sort of remove the ones 
that are open and throw it back cook it in the

broth for about one more minute to see if it 
will open some of them really do take longer

than others and if they still don't open then 
you can just chuck it that means the muscle was

dead and we don't want to eat that now if I had 
some fries this would be a great mood feat so

what I like to do is I want to make sure that 
I get some broth with my muscles I always use

a spoon take some bread dip it in that broth 
that is like liquid gold this broth is so good

all the flavors work together so well from all 
the different herbs and even though I didn't

add any sugar the slight sweetness from the 
tomatoes balance out of the saltiness and the

tartness of the lime juice and it's so light so 
refreshing nothing could be better than this with

a cold glass of white wine on a patio oh my god 
such a great idea I should brought some wine so

the recipe as always is aa Thai kitchen calm if 
you make this send me a photo Facebook Twitter

Instagram I love seeing your photos and I will see 
you next time for your next delicious Thai meal
Oh
